result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion and Lisa Hirschman appeared by telephone.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 14CF185.

This bond includes cases 15CF4; 14CM242 and 14CF185:  Bond posted 2/10/15:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Curfew from 8:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m..  remains in effect.  AMENDED 1/6/16.  Any prior reference to an alternate curfew when defendant is participating in basketball is struck.  Defendant is no longer participating in basketball.
Plea hearing at 02-01-2016 10:00 am
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have an agreement.  Set for plea hearing 2/1/16 at 10 am.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Sebion. (CF files only) Defendant is in custody in Jackson County Jail.  Have an offer from the State.  Keep 1/21/16 STC on all open cases.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Defendant has been in custody and that is the reason for his failure to appear.  Cash bond reinstated with amendment.  STC set for 1/11/16 at 3 pm.

Status conference at 01-11-2016 03:00 pm
in custody JASO; appeared before the court
for certified copy of bond and complaint from Sauk Co. DA's office.
body only.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant did not appear .  Attorneys Hirschman and Sebion appeared...  Defendant has a probation warrant.  Court authorized warrant.
Status conference at 08-10-2015 03:00 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney William Poss.  Defendant unable to appear in court today.  STC set for 8/10/15 at 3 pm
Status conference at 07-27-2015 03:45 pm
Status conference at 07-27-2015 03:00 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Sebion.  Defendant is currently in treatment. STC set for 7/27/15  at 3 pm
Status conference at 04-27-2015 03:00 pm

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Reading of information waived and defendant stood mute to charge.  NGP entered by the court.  Attorney Sebion advised the court that the defendant has been accepted to go to treatment 45-60 days as ATR.  Defendant cannot apply to HCN healing to wellness because of pending charges in this court.  Judge set STC for 4/27/15 at 3 pm to see if defendant is in treatment.
Arraignment at 03-30-2015 02:45 pm

This bond includes 14CF185 and 15CF4:   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Curfew from 8:00 P.M. to 8:00 A.M. on nights he does not have basketball.  On nights he has basketball the curfew is from 10:00 P.M. to 8:00 A.M.  
AMENDED 3-19-15:  After the jail receives confirmation of arrangments defendant may be released to travel directly to in-patient treatment and then must return immediately upon completion and report to his probation agent.  Must reside at his mother's residence at 214 S. 3rd St., Apt 15, Black River Falls, WI 54615.

Defendant appeared in custody in person from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing and explains what it entails.  Defendant states he still wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds he knowingly and intelligently waives his right to a preliminary hearing on 14CF185 & 15CF4.  Bound over for trial.  DA will file the Information at a later date.  Arraignment set for 3-30-15 at 2:45.  DA requests bond be amended to a signature bond so defendant can be released to go to in-patient treatment when arrangements are made.  Court ordered a $10,000 signature bond with added conditions that he is released to travel directly from the jail to the in-patient treatment facility and then must return immediately and report to his probation agent.  He is to reside with his mother at 214 S. 3rd St., Apt 15, Black River Falls, WI.  He may be released until arrangements have been confirmed.  Back on record at 10:51 - Judge clarifies there is already a signed cash bond on file so there is no need for the signature bond.  The conditions will be modified on the cash bond to reflect what was ordered earlier.  He is on a probation hold.
Consent to Withdraw. NOTE paper document not in file.
From attorney Araysa Simpson along with Consent and Order to Withdraw which was all sent to the Judge NOTE: Paper document not in file.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Dean Taylor to appear at preliminary hearing on 3/19/15.
